body_html:
Hi killeent,

Thanks for your reply. An example:

x = torch.randn(3, 4, 5)
y = torch.randn(3, 2, 5)
ix = torch.LongTensor([1, 3])
x[:, ix, :] = y

x and y are tensors agreeing in the first and last dimensions. ix is a LongTensor
referencing some subset of the second dimension of x. I would like to set this subset with y
as one might do in numpy style code.

Thanks,

Duncan

body:
Hi killeent, 

Thanks for your reply. An example:

```python
x = torch.randn(3, 4, 5)
y = torch.randn(3, 2, 5)
ix = torch.LongTensor([1, 3])
x[:, ix, :] = y
```
```x``` and ```y``` are tensors agreeing in the first and last dimensions. ```ix``` is a LongTensor 
referencing some subset of the second dimension of ```x```. I would like to set this subset with ```y```
as one might do in numpy style code.

Thanks,

Duncan
